results.title: The Magna Carta. Part 1. The Rise of the English monarchy
results.creator_credit: John Barnes and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: The reigns of William the Conqueror, Henry I, Stephen of Bois, Henry Plantagenet and Richard the Lionheart are dramatised in this film which traces the history of England from the Norman invasion in 1066 to the crowning of King John in 1199. The background of feudalism - against which the drama of English kings and barons was portrayed - sets the scene for the famous meeting at Runnymede which resulted in Magna Carta. The film was shot as far as possible on the actual locations of these historical events.

results.title: The Magistrates
results.brief_description: A re-enactment of parts of a typical Monday morning’s proceedings of a city magistrates’ court in New South Wales (called Petty Sessions in that State). Also includes visits and extensive interviews with justices and lawyers about New South Wales county court system and justice system. Presented by Gerald Stone.

results.title: The Magician
results.creator_credit: Tadeusz Makarczynski, Walter Reade, Semafor Studios and Sterling Educational Films
results.brief_description: An anti-war film in the form of an allegory. A magician attracts a group of children at a beach. At first he amuses them with innocent tricks but gradually they are led into playing with guns, the guns finally become real.

results.title: The Magician
results.creator_credit: Ingmar Bergman, Allan Ekelund and Svensk Filmindustri
results.brief_description: A 19th century hypnotist, Dr Vogler (Max Von Sydow), and his wife Manda (Ingrid Thulin), dressed as a man are scrutinised and ridiculed by Dr Vergerus (Gunnar Bjornstrand) due to sceptisicm towards their “magic” performance. Vogler seeks retribution for this humiliation by performing the greatest conjuring trick of them all- faking his own death. Vogler’s actions lead to the murder of a local constable who later returns to haunt the dead. Described as “a thinking man’s horror movie”, this film was awarded Special Jury and Cinema Nuovo Prizes at the Venice Film Festival, 1959. In Swedish with English subtitles.

results.title: The Magical world of J.K. Rowling
results.creator_credit: Steven Grant and Video Release Productions
results.brief_description: Winner of the British Book Awards prestigious Author of the Year award in 1999, J.K. (Joanne Kathleen) Rowling, a single mother with a young daughter, is responsible for creating one of the most popular children’s series in modern times. Her tales of young wizard Harry Potter, and his adventures at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry have been translated into 25 different languages. This documentary discusses where the idea for Harry came from and where it all began. Also includes interviews with childhood friends of the author, literary critics, bookstore owners and children, asking for their views on the Harry Potter phenomenon.

results.title: The Magic well
results.brief_description: An adaptation of the Grimm Brothers fairy tale “Frau Holle”, in which two sisters journey to an enchanted land where kindness is rewarded by Mother Holle. Shows how the girls’ jouneys have very different results.

results.title: The Magic tree
results.creator_credit: Gerald McDermott and Landmark Educational Media
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “African folklore”.
A haunting tale from the Congo about Movgumgu, a homely, unloved boy who leaves his family for a lonely river voyage. Relates his experiences with a Magic Tree which he finds in a river clearing.

results.title: The Magic touch
results.creator_credit: Mushir Ahmad, V. Shantaram and Films Division, Government of India
results.brief_description: A visual impression of Indian arts and crafts, recording the skill of the country’s artisans. Shows filigree from Cuttack and Hyderabad, the enamelled brassware of Moradabad, Jaipur and Lucknow, bronze figures from South India, ivory models wrought in Mysore and Travancore, the papiermache work from Kashmir.
